ygData.subject: RE: Twinking
ygData.msgSnippet: Jaez -  hehe -- this is me - I think you think silky was me but she is not. I admit I am totally twinked!  In fact, I even made a social key.  But it is
ygData.messageBody:
Jaez - hehe -- this is me - I think you think "silky" was me but she is
not.

I admit I am totally twinked! In fact, I even made a social key. But it is
still great fun.

Here is the story:

Late one night, early 4th of July weekend, me and couple of my fiends are in
Rivervale begging for a bind. I see Silvera Tinkerbelle who I know from a
server email list and run over to say "hi I just wanted to meet you!" (She
is lev 48 or 49 and I am impressed!) She actually talks to me and I nearly
faint! Well, we do some duck dancing and other stoopid char tricks and
generally hang out.

Then she inspects my equipment and goes: "Greetings Sylly, looks like you
could use some armor?" I say: "Well yes, if you know anyone selling banded,
I do have some plats saved up." She says come to the bank and lemme look
what I might have... Then my trade screen come up and she drops in a couple
of pieces of stuff I don't even recognize. Then she fills the trade screen
and says 'take'

At that point - I say to her "ya know I am way too low level for this..."
And she says "I will understand if you say no..." But I think - hey this is
the chance of a life time! So I take!

Then she fills the trade screen a second time and I am frantically looking
to see if I got nuff slots and destroying all my food and beetle eyes. She
says take.

And that is how the Bronze bard was born (I even told her: "I will have to
call you Silvera Twinkerbelle from now on" and she goes LOL!)

Whether it's for penance for my sins or what - one of my 'things' is I will
make free patch work armor for young adventurers. If they bring me skins,
fine otherwise ill even buy em and make. I really enjoy helping the young
ones get a start. Patch is the best thing for new adventurers and I try to
help as many as I can. Casters - you need to go to Millers by Surefall
tunnel in Qeynos Hills and get them to make you stuff - casters can wear and
it has AC.

A long time ago, I saw a guy in all banded running back to the guards at T2.
I thot that was too ridiculous and posted a rant on some web site about
twinking. This was back when I thought you should stand toe to toe with the
monsters and fight for your honor! Well, now I am the one in all bronze
running for the zone yelping "trin tran train to the zone@!@
<mailto:zone@!@> "

More and more are bronze is coming out now and I have made some decent
levels so my days as a spectacle are nearly over <sigh> I am going to miss
all the attention!

/ooc you are NOT anonymous on the internet - you are who you are! What ever
you do is how people will know you. I have many friends in char and love
meeting new people. I thank you for seeing the real me - I am a bronze
twink no denying that but I also try to do other stuff and keep things for
everyone!

Sylly
Bard of the 17th level
a.k.a. Robo-Bard
Swimming across Lake Rathe
omw to get me corpse
somewhere on Innoruuk



-----Original Message-----
From: FRD [mailto:frd@...]
Sent: Friday, July 16, 1999 8:16 PM
To: eqbards@onelist.com
Subject: Re: [eqbards] Twinking

From: "FRD" <frd@...>

Be carefull Sylly

You were, and still Are, running around in full bronze plate
at way to low
a level, but since you are such a nice person, I dont mind.

That and Ive seen you many times and you havent gone from
9-30 in 3 weeks.
you seem to get enjoyment from the little things and I like
that....

Jaez

----------

> Date: Thursday, July 15, 1999 3:28 PM

> From: silky@...
>
>
>
> Hehhe, in my original reply - I think something has been
misunderstood
> along the way.
>
> I'm not against helping a new character a LITTLE - little
patchwork,
maybe
> a mino axe (easy and cheap enough to come by) few plat to
ease the
initial
> startup pain - and knowing an area is a HUGE plus on a
second character.
>
> I was outraged by lvl 1's in better stuff than I expect to
have at lvl
30,
> maybe even 40.
